healthy_leaf.suggestion: The leaf appears to be healthy. No immediate action is required.
care_tips: Maintain a consistent watering schedule, allowing soil to dry slightly between waterings.
Ensure the plant receives at least 4-6 hours of indirect sunlight daily.
Continue to monitor for any changes in appearance.

leaf_spot.suggestion: Leaf Spot Detected. This fungal or bacterial issue can spread. Isolate the plant if possible.
care_tips: Prune and safely destroy any infected leaves to prevent further spread.
Avoid getting the leaves wet; water the plant at the base.
Improve air circulation by spacing plants appropriately.
For severe cases, a copper-based or neem oil fungicide may be required.

powdery_mildew.suggestion: Powdery Mildew Detected. This common fungal disease thrives in high humidity.
care_tips: Gently wipe or wash the mildew off the leaves.
Increase air circulation and reduce humidity around the plant.
A solution of baking soda (1 tbsp) and a drop of liquid soap in 1 gallon of water can be an effective spray.
Ensure the plant has adequate spacing and access to morning sun to dry off dew.

root_rot.suggestion: Symptoms consistent with Root Rot Detected. This is a critical condition, often caused by overwatering.
care_tips: Immediately stop watering and allow the soil to dry out completely.
Gently remove the plant from its pot and inspect the roots. Trim any black, soft, or mushy roots.
Repot in a new pot with fresh, sterile, well-draining soil.
Ensure the pot has sufficient drainage holes and only water when the top inch of soil is dry.
